alert.note: Alert for St. Charles; Upper Jefferson; Western Orleans (Louisiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 22 at 3:52PM CDT by NWS New Orleans
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of north central St. Charles, west central Orleans and northwestern Jefferson Parishes through 415 PM CDT... At 350 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Jefferson, or near Metairie, moving northwest at 10 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... New Orleans, Metairie, Marrero, Avondale, Harvey, Jefferson, Gretna, Harahan, Westwego, Elmwood, Bridge City, River Ridge, Waggaman, St. Rose, Ama, Destrehan, New Orleans Armstrong Airport and Lakefront Airport. This includes the following Interstates... Interstate 10 in Louisiana between mile markers 218 and 243. Interstate 310 between mile markers 1 and 4. Interstate 610 between mile markers 1 and 4. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Heavy rain from can also result in significantly reduced visibility along area roadways. Motorists should be prepared for sudden changes in visibility if driving through the area, including those on Interstates 10, 310 and 610.

area.areaDesc: St. Charles; Upper Jefferson; Western Orleans
